name: Spicy Beef & Potato Empanadas
description: Fried empanadas filled with seasoned ground beef and potatoes. Optional cheese variation included in instructions.

ingredients.name: Shredded Colby Jack Cheese
ingredients.notes: ~10 oz. Use only if making cheese version.

instructions: Prepare Filling: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown ground beef, breaking it up. Drain excess grease.
Add Veggies: Add diced onions, bell peppers, and jalapeños. Cook until softened (5-7 min).
Add Aromatics: Stir in minced garlic and tomato paste. Cook 1 minute.
Simmer Sauce: Pour in beef broth, green onions, green seasoning, cumin, garlic powder, sugar, salt, pepper, and AP seasoning to taste. Simmer 5-10 min until liquid reduces slightly.
Add Potatoes: Stir in pre-cooked diced potatoes.
Cool Filling: Remove from heat and let the filling cool slightly.
Cheese Version Prep: If making the cheese version, stir the shredded cheese into the cooled filling.
Assemble Empanadas: Place ~1/4 cup of filling (cheese or non-cheese) onto the center of each empanada disc.
Fold & Seal: Fold the dough over the filling to create a half-moon shape. Press the edges firmly with fingers or crimp with a fork to seal.
Heat Oil: Heat about 2-3 inches of frying oil in a deep pot or Dutch oven to 350°F (175°C).
Fry Empanadas: Carefully fry empanadas in batches (don't overcrowd the pot) for 3-5 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy.
Drain: Remove fried empanadas with a slotted spoon and drain on a wire rack or paper towels.
cookNotes: Recipe based on a 5-serving non-cheese version derived from a larger batch cook.
Cheese amount calculated based on the cheese version of the larger batch.
Dipping sauce (Mayo, Ketchup, Sriracha, Garlic, Honey, AP Seasoning, Paprika) recommended but not included in ingredients.
